alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 5:46PM EDT until October 08 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Essex County in New York * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM EDT, Minor road flooding has been reported in the towns of Ticonderoga, Westport, and Schroon Lake by local law enforcement. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriah, Elizabethtown, Port Henry, Crown Point Center, Jay In Essex County, Schroon Lake, Lewis, North Hudson, New Russia, Witherbee, Mineville, Underwood, Moriah Center, Mullen Bay, Wadhams, Ironville, Reber, Paradox, Deerhead and Grass Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
